summary: This is an email chain from March 16, 2020, discussing the postponement of a meeting related to the Epstein case due to the COVID-19 pandemic. An Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York updates the team that the meeting with an attorney is postponed, consistent with office directives to limit non-critical meetings, and suggests a conference call to discuss the case status and how to utilize the delay for research and review.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the email updating the team about postponing a meeting with an attorney due to COVID-19 and suggesting a conference call to discuss case status.

events.title: Meeting Postponement Due to COVID-19
events.description: A meeting previously scheduled with an attorney regarding the Epstein case is postponed indefinitely due to the COVID-19 pandemic and office directives to limit non-critical meetings.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: The COVID-19 pandemic caused the indefinite postponement of a meeting with an attorney related to the Epstein case.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issued directives to limit meetings to only those that are mission-critical.
The delay was seen as an opportunity to conduct additional research, prepare memos, review 302s (FBI interview reports), and examine search warrant results.
